result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam A. Juslen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any sentence currently being served to include but not limited to Outagamie Co. Case No. 14CF114.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

No contact whatsoever with any children under the age of 18 years unless specifically approved by supervising agent. Defendant is prohibited from having access to or using any piece of technology that has access to the internet.

Defendant to complete the Sex Offender Treatment Program. Defendant to register as a sex offender for life and comply with any and all sex offender registry requirements. Any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by supervising agent.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any sentence currently being served to include but not limited to Outagamie Co. Case No. 14CF114.

records.addlTxt:
Case called @ 1:10 p.m. Defendant Adam A Juslen in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Defendant Adam A Juslen in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of preliminary hearing. Probable cause found in each count. Defendant bound over for trial.  Information filed by DA Blader. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 4 & 5 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Cts 1-3 & 6-10 - DRI.  Def waives any PSI.  Court accepts waiver of PSI. Statement by DE.

Court orders: As to both counts: 16 yr term of imprisonment - Bifurcated SEH - 6 yrs IC/10 yrs ES - concurrent with each other and any sentence currently being served including but not limited to Outagamie County Case No. 14CF114  - No CFTS. ES Conditions:  Def to complete SOT program, No contact whatsoever with any children under the age of 18 yrs unless specifically approved by supervising agent, DE to register as a sex offender for life and comply with any sex offender registration requirements, Not to have access to or use any piece of technology that has internet access, Any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by supervising agent, Costs to include the child pornography surcharge of $500 per count and the DNA surcharge per count to be paid from up to 25% of inmate earnings during IC. Defendant is not eligible for CIP or SAP. Appeal rights given.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum - Outagamie County Jail

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 9:55 AM: Defendant Adam A Juslen in court with attorney John B Selsing.  Scott C Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 09:05 am.
